quizzes.title: History Quiz: Movie and Los Angeles
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, osment, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What NASA astronauts made the first untethered space walk in history in 1984?

options.text: Terence T. Henricks and Bruce E. Melnick
Anna Lee Fisher and Frederick D. Gregory
Bruce McCandless II and Robert L. Stewart

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bruce McCandless II and Robert L. Stewart

questions.question: R2D2 and C3PO are part of what saga?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Star Wars

questions.question: What characters do Haley Joel Osment and Jude Law play in the 2001 sci-fi flick, A.I.: Artificial Intelligence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A robot and a robot

questions.question: What actress won the Academy Award for Best Actress at the 56th Academy Awards on April 9, 1984 in Los Angeles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shirley MacLaine

questions.question: What legendary Hollywood actress was the second wife of actor Richard Burton, who passed away in 1984?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth Taylor

questions.question: The first human birth through embryo transfer was announced on February 3, 1984. Who was in charge of the research team that carried out the project?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. John Buster

questions.question: What American Idol finalist was born on March 25, 1984, in Los Angeles, California?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Katharine McPhee

questions.question: How do mermaids enchant people according to legends and myths?

options.text: By sprinkling them with magic powder

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By singing

questions.question: What model of robot does Arnold Schwarzenegger play in the Terminator series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: T-101

questions.question: What did United States President Ronald Reagan say on the radio during a voice check on August 11, 1984?

options.text: I wanna tell my mama I love her.
We begin bombing in five minutes.
I must tell you, Im wearing white-red-and-blue underpants today.
Wait, do I speak now? Is this thing on?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: We begin bombing in five minutes.

questions.question: Harrison Ford stars in Blade Runner.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the movie, Short Circuit, what is Number 5s original function?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Weapon

questions.question: Where does WALL-E find the plant in the self-titled movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In a refrigerator

questions.question: What world-famous female model was born on February 28, 1984?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Karolina Kurkova

questions.question: What movie featured the humanoid robot, named Gort?

options.text: The Day the Earth Stood Still

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Day the Earth Stood Still

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Mermaids and City
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, field, hans. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What type of books are called novela rosa, or pink novel, in Spain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sentimental novels

questions.question: In what city a principal of an elementary school got a pink Mohawk haircut on 6 September 2007, as he had promised to do if the students raised the school’s Academic Performance Index by at least 55 points?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Francisco

questions.question: Between the 1920s and 1940s, the pink color was considered appropriate for this group of people, but later it became popular with others too.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boys

questions.question: According to a popular Greek legend, Thessalonike, the sister of this historical figure, was transformed into a mermaid after her death.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexander the Great

questions.question: Why would mermaids drown humans according to popular belief and different stories?

options.text: Because they forget humans cant breathe underwater
In attempts to rescue them from drowning

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the name of the mermaid character from Disneys 1989 animated movie The Little Mermaid?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ariel

questions.question: In the French academic dress system, what academic field is symbolized by the redcurrant color -- an extremely red shade of pink?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Medicine

questions.question: How are mermaids portrayed in the collection of stories Arabian Nights, or One Thousand and One Nights?

options.text: As having a fish body and a human head

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: As identical to humans

questions.question: A mermaid is the symbol of this European city; depicted on its coat of arms, it can be seen on statues throughout the city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Warsaw

questions.question: What day of the week is associated with the pink color in Thailand?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tuesday

questions.question: What are mermaids generally associated with in British folklore?

options.text: They bring luck to those who have seen them.
They make those who have seen them irresistible for the opposite sex.
They are considered a bad omen.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are considered a bad omen.

questions.question: What singer and actress starred in the 1990 dramedy movie Mermaids?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cher

questions.question: What happens to the Little Mermaid at the end of Hans Christian Andersens fairy tale The Little Mermaid?

options.text: She returns to the underwater world and marries a merman.
She dies and is damned for eternity.
She marries the prince and they live happily ever after.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Her body turns into foam.

questions.question: The pink ribbon is associated with raising awareness for what disease?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Breast cancer

questions.question: What is the name of the mermaid-like creature from Brazilian folklore?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iara

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Person and Accident
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, bush, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what country is a cake called Pink Panther very popular?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spain

questions.question: US Army Lt. Thomas Selfridge was the first person killed in a powered fixed-wing aircraft. Where did the accident happen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virginia

questions.question: When did a war start over a postage stamp?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1932

questions.question: What is the term that denotes an airplane accident in which the plane is a total loss?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hull loss incident

questions.question: Otto Lilienthal, the first person to make repeated successful gliding flights, died after an airplane accident on 10 August 1896. What were the last words he uttered moments before he passed away?

options.text: I am not dying in vain, I am dying in the name of progress

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sacrifices must be made

questions.question: What do these  people have in common: both Presidents Bush, actor James Spader, actor Jack Lemmon, actor Humphrey Bogart and writer Edgar Rice  Burroughs?

options.text: They all went to the same high school.
They all were in Texas on 9/11/2001.
They are the same Zodiac sign.
They were all born in the same month.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They all went to the same high school.

questions.question: What is the real name of the American female artist known as Pink?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alecia

questions.question: Which college did William Shakespeare attend?

options.text: He did not go to college

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He did not go to college

questions.question: What is the most common reason for airplane incidents?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Human error

questions.question: Which of these statements is not correct?

options.text: The Smithsonian Institute is the longest building in the world.
All race horses are considered to have been born on January first.
There is a list of unsolved math problems called the Milenium Problems. Anyone solving them is guaranteed $1,000,000 in prize money.
The same man who invented the toy The Transformers also invented the hole cam, the camera used to see the hole cards on TV poker shows.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Smithsonian Institute is the longest building in the world.

questions.question: Who was the first American novelist  to be considered an imoportant writer by the Europeans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Quincy Adams

questions.question: During World War II, no Axis troops landed on any of the 48 American states.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Paul Erdos (pronounced Irr-dish) was a Hungarian mathematician with a very peculiar trait. What is it?

options.text: He memorized all the prime numbers from 2 through 5,986,771,223
He has said that he prefers mathematics to sex.
He is the only mathematician to have won an Oscar.
He is a self-taught mathematician - he wrote his Doctor thesis without ever taking a course in any college.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He has said that he prefers mathematics to sex.

questions.question: What is the lowest point in Europe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Caspian Sea

questions.question: What was Freddie Mercurys real name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Farroukh Bulsara

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Fear and Reason
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, condition, air. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: There is an actual medical term for the fear of peanut butter sticking to the roof of ones mouth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What was the main cause for Airline hull loss accidents from 1996 through 2005, according to a study by Boeing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flight crew error

questions.question: Helminthophobia is the fear of what?

options.text: of seeing blood or bloody objects

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: of being infested with worms

questions.question: 6 am:  My alarm went off and my 4-year-old daughter jumped in bed with me, triggering my pedophobia. What was I afraid of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Children

questions.question: Selachophobia is the fear of this sea creature.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: shark

questions.question: What was the reason for the Tenerife airplane disaster of March 27, 1977?

options.text: The airplane crashed into a hospital
Two airplanes collided on the runway before takeoff

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Two airplanes collided on the runway before takeoff

questions.question: Didaskaleinophobia is the fear of animals that have rabies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Potophobia is the abnormal fear of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: alcohol

questions.question: What caused the Air India Flight 182 crash on June 23, 1985, when 329 people passed away?

options.text: One of the pilots had a heart attack

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bomb explosion on board

questions.question: What was the reason for the 1996 Charkhi Dadri mid-air collision of two airplanes over Haryana, India?

options.text: There was a storm and visibility was poor
One of the airplanes was flying at a lower altitude than permitted
Both airplanes were experiencing technical problems before the collision

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One of the airplanes was flying at a lower altitude than permitted

questions.question: Samhainophobia is the fear of this holiday.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Halloween

questions.question: What condition is characterized by fear of hurricanes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lilapsophobia

questions.question: Where did the Turkish Airlines Flight 981 McDonnell Douglas DC-10 crash on On March 3, 1974?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Close to Paris

questions.question: Which of these airplane disasters is considered the deadliest in history?

options.text: The destruction of the World Trade Center

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The destruction of the World Trade Center

questions.question: Which of the following fears is not of a color?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mageirocophobia

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Bathroom and Husband
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, screams, plot. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: My husband came downstairs dressed for work, thus setting off my coulrophobia. What was I afraid of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clowns

questions.question: I tried to run away, but I couldnt get far due to my agyrophobia. What was I afraid of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crossing roads

questions.question: I was trying to calm myself when my mind settled on my greatest fear, defined as taphopobia. I freaked out. What was I afraid of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Being buried alive

questions.question: I ran outside but stopped dead due to my anthophobia. What was I afraid of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flowers

questions.question: I sat back down on my bed and looked around my room. This triggered my autophobia. What was I afraid of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Being alone

questions.question: I ran from my bathroom into the kitchen where I decided to eat breakfast to calm my nerves. Unfortunately, my aichmophobia was provoked when I opened the silverware drawer. What was I afraid of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pointed objects

questions.question: I ran into the bathroom and decided to brush my teeth. Upon looking up, I panicked due to my spectrophobia. What was I afraid of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mirrors

questions.question: I decided to return home, but when I walked in the front door there was a party in progress and my choreophobia caused me to panic yet again. What was I afraid of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dancing

questions.question: I ran to my room and my daughter brought me a bowl of vegetable soup, but I couldnt eat it due to my phagophobia. What was I afraid of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Swallowing

questions.question: Upon hearing my screams, my husband stepped out of the shower to make sure I was alright, causing me recoil due to my gymnophobia. What was I afraid of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nudity

questions.question: The plot of the 1968 Stanley Kubrick movie 2001: A Space Odyssey involves a space mission to which planet of the Solar system?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jupiter

questions.question: I went to my closet to get dressed for work, but this threw me into a panic due to my decidophobia. What was I afraid of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Making decisions

questions.question: What happens to criminal Johnny Clay at the end of the 1956 movie The Killing, directed by Stanley Kubrick?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He is arrested.

questions.question: Well, it was getting dark and I was worn out from the stress of the day, so I decided to get ready for bed. Sadly, this prompted a panic attack due to my ablutophobia. What was I afraid of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bathing

questions.question: One of my companion animals entered the bathroom and brought about my ailurophobia. What was I afraid of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cats

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Movie and Actor
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, actor, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these terms denotes an insertion of an object underneath the skin to create a raised design?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What movie directed by Stanley Kubrick was nominated for seven Academy Awards?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barry Lyndon

questions.question: What actor played three different roles in Stanley Kubricks 1964 movie Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter Sellers

questions.question: Trepanation is a term that denotes making a hole in this part of the body.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Skull

questions.question: What actor portrayed rebellious slave Spartacus in Stanley Kubricks 1960 historical movie Spartacus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kirk Douglas

questions.question: What celebrity couple starred in Stanley Kubricks 1999 neo-noir psychological thriller movie Eyes Wide Shut?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Cruise and Nicole Kidman

questions.question: Which of these methods is used in tongue splitting, an example of extreme body modification?

options.text: Tightening of a nylon bind around a tongue piercing

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the last statement made by Alex at the end of the 1971 Stanley Kubrick movie A Clockwork Orange?

options.text: Nothing on this planet is what it seems to be.
I see the tunnel clearly now.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I was cured, all right!

questions.question: What catchy tagline was used for the theatrical poster of the 1962 movie Lolita, directed by Stanley Kubrick?

options.text: How did they ever make a movie of Lolita?
What on earth were they thinking?
Most scandalous film of all time
She was only a child. Until...

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: How did they ever make a movie of Lolita?

questions.question: In which of these areas is stretching the neck with neck rings practiced?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Africa and Asia

questions.question: In what part of the body is the cosmetic procedure known as corneal tattooing done?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eyeball

questions.question: What actor starred in Stanley Kubricks 1980 psychological horror movie The Shining?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Nicholson

questions.question: What type of movie is the 1987 Stanley Kubrick film Full Metal Jacket?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: War movie

questions.question: In what geographic area is tooth filing practiced?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In which country was eyeball jewelry, or extraocular implantation, developed in 2002?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Netherlands
